result.execSummary:
The defendant William D Steinfort was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William D Steinfort

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

ADDRESS INFO for William D Steinfort
Current: PO Box 282, Coloma, WI 54930 United States  (Effective: 04-05-2017)
Prior: 141 E Westfield Rd, Coloma, WI 54930

Case called @ 2:52 p.m. Defendant William D Steinfort in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Statement by DE. Court orders: Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP, DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal rights given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 18, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  P/S requested and scheduled.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 18, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Status conference on June 3, 2016 at 02:20 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant William D Steinfort in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi, both appearing in person.   Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  STC adjourned as requested.  Status conference scheduled for June 3, 2016 at 02:20 pm.
Status conference on April 20, 2016 at 02:15 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.   Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.

Case Called @ 2:25PM: Defendant William D Steinfort in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.    NGP received and entered.   ADA argues as to Signature Bond w/conditions.  No objection by SPD as to bond request.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for April 20, 2016 at 02:15 pm.
Return of Search Warrant, Search Warrant, Application for Search Warrant and Search Warrant Return - Steinfort residence at 141 East Westfield Road, Coloma WI
